security: Disclosing details about surveillance and assessment of individuals, particularly regarding KGB connections and reliability assessments, could compromise ongoing intelligence operations and sources. For example, the memo states: 'PG ON KGB WATCH LIST - YOW,' and 'SU BONA FIDES REP. ELIABILITY NOTES PABUNDED.' Revealing these internal evaluations could alert individuals and foreign agencies to CIA scrutiny.
summary: This memo details information on Pavel Golovachev (PG), his background, possible connections to the KGB, and assessments of individuals associated with Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty. It also includes information on Soviet interpreters traveling abroad and KGB offices in Minsk.
summary_one_paragraph: This CIA memo, dated January 19, 1977, summarizes information pertaining to Pavel Golovachev (PG), noting his potential KGB connections and his status on a KGB watch list. The memo includes details from a cable dated 3/77, describing PG as aggressive and outgoing but unable to hold a steady job, along with his DOB (11/19/49) and details about knowing someone in Germany. It also provides insight on Jan Zaprudnik, a Belorussian correspondent for Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty, and offers observations on Soviet interpreters traveling abroad, as well as KGB offices located in Minsk, including their associates at the 'Yobileynaya' Hotel.
title: Appendix to Memo - REMOVE PRIS provisions, Report By S. 11200V
